title: Advanced Passive
description: Слушайте сложные пассивные конструкции в формальном контексте.

tasks.audioText: The pharmaceutical company faced regulatory scrutiny. It is believed that the drug's side effects were deliberately understated in the original report.
tasks.transcript: It is believed that the drug's side effects were deliberately understated in the original report.

options.text: People think the adverse reactions were intentionally downplayed in the initial documentation.
The drug had no side effects whatsoever.
The report accurately described all side effects.
The company voluntarily disclosed all side effects.

tasks.explanation: 'It is believed that...' is an impersonal passive reporting a widely held opinion without attributing it to a specific source.

tasks.audioText: The suspect was brought in for questioning again. He is thought to have been involved in at least three similar incidents previously.
tasks.transcript: He is thought to have been involved in at least three similar incidents previously.

options.text: He has been cleared of all previous charges.
It is suspected that he participated in three or more comparable cases before.
He has confessed to all the incidents.
This is his first time being questioned by police.

tasks.explanation: 'Is thought to have been involved' combines the passive with a perfect infinitive to express a belief about past actions. The suspicion covers multiple incidents.

tasks.audioText: The ancient manuscript was discovered in a monastery library. It is said to contain previously unknown accounts of medieval trade routes.
tasks.transcript: It is said to contain previously unknown accounts of medieval trade routes.

options.text: The manuscript is reportedly empty.
According to reports, the text includes undiscovered descriptions of trade paths from the Middle Ages.
The manuscript was a modern forgery.
The trade routes described are already well documented.

tasks.explanation: 'It is said to contain' is a passive construction with a to-infinitive expressing what people reportedly claim about the manuscript's contents.

tasks.audioText: The young entrepreneur's latest venture attracted media attention. She is reported to have secured over fifty million dollars in venture capital funding.
tasks.transcript: She is reported to have secured over fifty million dollars in venture capital funding.

options.text: According to reports, she raised more than fifty million in investment capital.
She failed to attract any investors.
She invested fifty million of her own money.
The media ignored her business venture.

tasks.explanation: 'Is reported to have secured' uses the passive with perfect infinitive to convey a reported completed action without naming the source.

tasks.audioText: The data breach affected millions of users worldwide. Customers are being urged to change their passwords and enable two-factor authentication.
tasks.transcript: Customers are being urged to change their passwords and enable two-factor authentication.

options.text: Users are currently being encouraged to update their security credentials and add extra verification.
Customers do not need to take any action.
The company disabled all customer accounts.
Two-factor authentication was removed from the platform.

tasks.explanation: 'Are being urged' is the present continuous passive, showing that the encouragement to act is happening right now in response to the breach.

tasks.audioText: The professor lectured on economic inequality. The wealth gap is understood to have widened considerably over the past two decades.
tasks.transcript: The wealth gap is understood to have widened considerably over the past two decades.

options.text: The wealth gap has narrowed significantly.
It is generally recognized that economic disparity has grown substantially in the last twenty years.
Nobody has studied economic inequality recently.
The wealth gap remained exactly the same.

tasks.explanation: 'Is understood to have widened' uses the passive with perfect infinitive to express a commonly accepted view about a past trend.

tasks.audioText: The infrastructure project ran significantly over budget. The contractor is alleged to have submitted fraudulent invoices throughout the construction period.
tasks.transcript: The contractor is alleged to have submitted fraudulent invoices throughout the construction period.

options.text: The contractor was praised for transparent billing.
It is claimed that the builder filed fake bills during the entire construction phase.
The project was completed under budget.
The contractor refused to submit any invoices.

tasks.explanation: 'Is alleged to have submitted' is a passive with perfect infinitive used for unproven accusations. The claim covers the whole construction period.

tasks.audioText: The new employee struggled with the complex filing system at first. Eventually, she got accustomed to the procedure and handled it with ease.
tasks.transcript: Eventually, she got accustomed to the procedure and handled it with ease.

options.text: She never adapted to the filing system.
She quit her job because the system was too difficult.
Over time, she became familiar with the process and managed it effortlessly.
Someone else did the filing for her.

tasks.explanation: 'Got accustomed to' uses the 'get + past participle' passive, emphasizing the process of becoming adapted. She transitioned from struggling to competence.

tasks.audioText: The archaeological site yielded remarkable findings. The artefacts are estimated to date back over three thousand years.
tasks.transcript: The artefacts are estimated to date back over three thousand years.

options.text: The objects are thought to be more than three millennia old.
The artefacts are modern reproductions.
Scientists cannot determine the age of the artefacts.
The artefacts are less than a century old.

tasks.explanation: 'Are estimated to date back' uses the passive with to-infinitive to report an expert assessment of age without specifying who made the estimate.

tasks.audioText: The international summit addressed the refugee crisis. It was agreed that humanitarian corridors should be established along the affected borders.
tasks.transcript: It was agreed that humanitarian corridors should be established along the affected borders.

options.text: The summit participants reached a consensus to create safe passage routes near the impacted borders.
No agreement was reached at the summit.
The borders were permanently closed.
Humanitarian corridors were deemed unnecessary.

tasks.explanation: 'It was agreed that... should be established' uses the impersonal passive to report a collective decision without attributing it to any individual.

tasks.audioText: The cycling race became chaotic in the final stretch. Several competitors got knocked off their bikes in a pile-up near the finish line.
tasks.transcript: Several competitors got knocked off their bikes in a pile-up near the finish line.

options.text: All riders finished the race without incident.
Multiple racers were thrown from their bicycles in a crash close to the end.
The finish line was moved to a different location.
The race was cancelled before it started.

tasks.explanation: 'Got knocked off' uses the 'get + past participle' passive to describe a sudden, dynamic event. It conveys the action happening to the riders involuntarily.

tasks.audioText: The government announced new environmental regulations. The policy is expected to reduce carbon emissions by thirty percent within five years.
tasks.transcript: The policy is expected to reduce carbon emissions by thirty percent within five years.

options.text: Carbon emissions are predicted to increase under the new policy.
The regulation is anticipated to cut carbon output by nearly a third in half a decade.
The policy has no environmental targets.
Carbon emissions have already been eliminated entirely.

tasks.explanation: 'Is expected to reduce' uses the passive with to-infinitive to express a forecast. The anticipated outcome is a significant emissions cut.

tasks.audioText: The media covered the election extensively. The incumbent is widely considered to have lost the debate by a significant margin.
tasks.transcript: The incumbent is widely considered to have lost the debate by a significant margin.

options.text: Most people believe the current officeholder clearly lost the debate.
The incumbent won the debate convincingly.
No debate took place during the election.
Media coverage of the debate was minimal.

tasks.explanation: 'Is widely considered to have lost' combines an adverb-modified passive with a perfect infinitive, reporting a broadly shared assessment of the debate outcome.

tasks.audioText: The gallery displayed controversial contemporary art. The exhibition was intended to provoke discussion about the boundaries of artistic expression.
tasks.transcript: The exhibition was intended to provoke discussion about the boundaries of artistic expression.

options.text: The show aimed to spark debate about the limits of art.
The exhibition was intended to be calming and non-controversial.
The gallery only displayed traditional paintings.
Visitors were prohibited from discussing the artwork.

tasks.explanation: 'Was intended to provoke' uses a passive with to-infinitive to describe the purpose behind the exhibition. The goal was deliberate provocation of dialogue.

tasks.audioText: The investigation uncovered a network of shell companies. The funds are known to have been laundered through several offshore accounts before reaching their final destination.
tasks.transcript: The funds are known to have been laundered through several offshore accounts before reaching their final destination.

options.text: The money was legally transferred through domestic banks.
It is established that the money was illegally processed via multiple foreign accounts prior to arriving at its endpoint.
No suspicious financial activity was found.
The funds disappeared without a trace.

tasks.explanation: 'Are known to have been laundered' layers multiple passives — the reporting passive and the perfect passive infinitive — to describe an established fact about past illegal activity.

short_description: Сложные пассивные конструкции в формальной речи.
